io.codecastle.scriptorium

Interface FluentNode<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the parent type
    All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable

    public interface FluentNode<P>
extends Closeable
    A primitive for nested fluent interfaces.

    The then() method calls the close() method and returns a parent object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this node, and any child nodes that remain open.
      P then()
      Closes this node and returns its parent.

    • Method Detail

      • then

        P then()
throws IOException
        Closes this node and returns its parent.
        Returns:
        this node's parent
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        close()

      • close

        void close()
    throws IOException
        Closes this node, and any child nodes that remain open.

        Subsequent calls to this method after the first on the same object should have no effect.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
